context: The Estonian verb 'ootama' primarily means to wait for or await something or someone. It can be used in various contexts including waiting for transportation (like trams or trains), expecting letters, anticipating seasons, or expecting help or results. The word has different forms based on tense and person - ootan (I wait), ootad (you wait), ootab (he/she waits), etc. It also appears in the passive form as 'oodata' when used impersonally.
